business.headline: Reliance sees worst session since June 2024. What should investors do now?Reliance Industries shares closed 4.5% lower at Rs 1,507.6, marking their steepest decline since June 4, 2024. During the session, the stock slipped as much as 5.1% to Rs 1,496.30, hitting its lowest level since November 11, as selling pressure intensified.
Sensex ends 376 points lower, Nifty below 26,200; RIL tanks 4%The S&P BSE Sensex declined 376.28 points to close at 85,063.34, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 71.60 points to end at 26,178.70.

Tata Steel, JSW Steel and SAIL found in breach of antitrust laws: ReportThe Competition Commission of India has also held 56 top executives liable for price collusion over different periods between 2015 and 2023.

Why US–Venezuela tensions have global markets watching oil and goldTensions between the US and Venezuela are worrying markets because oil supplies and economic stability could be affected if the situation worsens. Here's all you need to know.

Reliance share price crashes 5%: Is it good time to buy the stock?RIL share price: The stock opened slightly lower at Rs 1,575.55 and remained under selling pressure through the session. At the time of writing, the share price was at Rs 1,509, down Rs 68.45 or 4.34%.

Is Venezuela the trigger, or is gold and silver's rally bigger than geopolitics?In India, MCX gold is trading at a lifetime high. A decisive breakout could push prices sharply higher, while lower levels continue to attract buyers rather than panic sellers. MCX silver, trading over Rs 2.5 lakh, remains in an uptrend as long as key support zones hold.

Cupid share price rebounds sharply, up 9% today. Here's whyThe rebound follows a brutal sell-off on Monday, when the stock plunged nearly 20% after a large block deal weighed on sentiment and triggered aggressive profit-booking.

HDFC Bank share price falls over 2% after Q3 business updateHDFC Bank shares were among the top drags on benchmark indices as selling pressure intensified, even as the broader market traded lower in early deals.

Reliance share price down over 4%. Why is it falling today?The fall in Reliance shares comes against the backdrop of a broader market correction. Both the Sensex and the Nifty traded lower in early deals as investors turned cautious on global cues and reduced exposure to heavyweight stocks.

Trent shares fall 8%: Why is the stock falling today, and should you buy?Trent share price: The stock opened lower at Rs 4,219.90 and slipped further to an intraday low of Rs 4,060.65, close to its 52-week low of Rs 3,931.45.
Sensex opens 150 points lower, Nifty below 26,300; RIL down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 238.67 points to 85,200.95, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 57.15 points to 26,193.15 as of 9:22 am.

Reliance Industries denies report on Russian oil deliveries to Jamnagar refineryReliance clarified that its Jamnagar refinery has not received any cargo of Russian oil in the past three weeks. The company also said it is not expecting any deliveries of Russian crude oil in January.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO: Price band out, does GMP point to 50% listing gains?Bharat Coking Coal IPO is a book-built issue of Rs 1,071.11 crore. The entire issue is an offer for sale of 46.57 crore shares, with no fresh issue component.

US plans talks with oil companies on boosting Venezuela output after Maduro ousterThe meetings are crucial to the administration's hopes of getting top US oil companies back into the South American nation after its government, nearly two decades ago, took control of US-led energy operations there.
Sensex closes 322 points lower, Nifty below 26,300; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 322.39 points to close at 85,439.62, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 78.25 points to end at 26,250.30.

What worries RBI about India's insurance sector despite its stability?The RBI highlights that the insurance sector is systemically important because of its size, its role as a long-term investor, and its growing links with the wider financial system.

How investors can manage short-term uncertainty with digital gold, ETFs and SGBsFrom an investment perspective, buying physical gold may no longer be the most efficient choice. When purchasing physical gold, investors must pay 3% GST upfront, which immediately impacts returns.

Gold prices rise again as US–Venezuela tensions flare. Buy now or wait?Market participants say the latest geopolitical flare-up has reinforced gold's role as a hedge against uncertainty, at a time when investors are already navigating an uneasy global backdrop.

Mis-selling complaints are rising. Here's what IRDAI's latest report showsData in the IRDAI Annual Report 2024–25 shows that grievances categorised under Unfair Business Practices increased to 26,667 in FY25, up from 23,335 in FY24, a rise of around 14% year-on-year.

US action on Venezuela's oil: Is there an opportunity for India?Indian oil refiners and upstream companies could still find opportunities if Venezuelan crude re-enters global markets and long-pending investments and payments are unlocked.

entertainment.headline: Vir Das shares how a message from Imran Khan led to his casting in Happy Patel Vir Das reveals Imran Khan's direct involvement in joining the cast of Happy Patel: Khatarnak Jasoos, produced by Aamir Khan Productions and set for release on January 16, 2026.

Vijay's Jana Nayagan censor row: Makers tell court film is fit for U/A The Madras High Court heard KVN Productions' plea over the delay in issuing a censor certificate for Vijay's Jana Nayagan. The makers told the court all CBFC cuts were complied with, and only the certificate is pending.

Vivek Oberoi shares throwback pic on AR Rahman's birthday: Forever in awe Vivek Oberoi celebrated AR Rahman's birthday by sharing a heartfelt throwback post praising the composer's timeless music and creative genius.

Priyanka Chopra wants to give herself pat on back: Grateful for surviving this far On Tuesday, Priyanka Chopra opened up about her New Year musings. She reflected on her life and hoped to be kind to herself in 2026.

Rahu Ketu trailer: Pulkit, Varun's film blends mythology with madcap comedy The trailer for Rahu Ketu has been released ahead of the film's January 16 release. The film blends mythology with mayhem, highlighting a comedic narrative infused with a larger philosophical message.

Stranger Things' Sadie Sink teases what she thinks happened to Eleven Sadie Sink discusses her interpretation of Eleven's ending in the Stranger Things finale, sharing her thoughts during an appearance on The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon.

The Raja Saab censor details: 2 violent scenes changed, Prabhas's film gets U/A The Raja Saab, starring Prabhas and directed by Maruthi, has been cleared by the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) with a U/A 16+ certificate after two scenes were modified.

Beyond the screen of jingoism: Ikkis and the integrity of the individual In an era of performative patriotism, Sriram Raghavan's Ikkis stands as a defiant cinematic feat. It rejects the easy dividends of jingoism to create a monument to pure, individual integrity.

Allu Arjun teams up with Lokesh Kanagaraj for mega-budget film starting in 2026 Allu Arjun is set to star in a new film directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, with shooting scheduled to commence in October 2026. The Pushpa producers are backing the project with a significant budget.

Parasakthi vs Jana Nayagan: Vijay fans target theatre over Sivakarthikeyan film A theatre in Tamil Nadu has reported facing abusive messages from Vijay fans after choosing to screen Sivakarthikeyan's Parasakthi instead of Vijay's Jana Nayagan for the upcoming Pongal festival.

Deepika Padukone's warm gesture at meet-and-greet leaves fan's mother emotional Deepika Padukone's warm gesture of holding the fan's mother's hand and inviting her to sit deeply moved the woman, who was left "almost in tears" after meeting the actor. The fan's mother presented a handmade Puran Poli, creating an unforgettable moment for both.

Pawan Singh's friend pushed off stage at birthday bash. Video goes viral During Bhojpuri superstar Pawan Singh's 40th birthday bash in Lucknow, a sudden scuffle erupted when his friend Vishal Singh was pushed off the stage by security staff, leaving guests shocked.

Natalia Dyer: Being Nancy Wheeler on Stranger Things was honour of a lifetime 'Stranger Things' actor Natalia Dyer shared her thoughts on portraying Nancy Wheeler in the popular series. In a post on social media, she expressed gratitude for the experience and highlighted the show's enduring impact on popular culture.

Dhurandhar: How Akshaye Khanna's viral FA9LA look as Rehman Dakait was finalised Costume designer Smriti Chauhan revealed the detailed process and inspiration behind Akshaye Khanna's striking black ensemble as Rehman Dakait in the film Dhurandhar, which has garnered significant attention since the film's release.

Shark Tank India 5 review: Makes entrepreneurship look fun - but is it really? Shark Tank India Season 5 began with diverse pitches and strong emotions. The show highlights both the glamour and tough realities of start-ups in India.

MasterChef India 9 review: A slow simmer of stories, culture and comfortRelease Date:Tue Jan 06, 2026 MasterChef India returns with its ninth season, choosing emotion, culture and familiarity over grandeur. The premiere focussed on stories and representation, setting a warm, heartland-driven tone ahead of the real competition.

Watch: Rashmika–Vijay back from Italy after New Year celebrations Actors Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda were seen arriving together at Hyderabad airport on Monday after celebrating the New Year in Italy. The two are reportedly set to marry in February.

When Rajamouli said he never liked Ram, and Krishna was his favourite avatar Filmmaker SS Rajamouli's old post has surfaced, where he confessed to never liking Lord Ram. In the X post, the self-proclaimed atheist also said Lord Krishna was his favourite avatar.

Jana Nayagan team goes to court over delay in issuing censor certificate The production team of Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan has urgently petitioned the Madras High Court regarding the Central Board of Film Certification's delay in granting a censor certificate. Jana Nayagan is set for grand release on January 9.

general news.headline: Closer look at new Chinese structures near Pangong Lake and what they meanHigh-resolution satellite imagery shows the permanent nature of new Chinese structures coming up close to the Pangong Tso buffer zone.

Over 2.89 crore names dropped from UP draft electoral roll after SIRThe Uttar Pradesh's CEO said that of the more than 15 crore voters in the old rolls, around 12 crore returned verification forms after signing them themselves or through a family member. This meant about 81 per cent of voters signed and returned the forms, while roughly 18 per cent did not.

DMK's 32-seat offer pushes Tamil Nadu Congress to pitch TVK tie-up to Rahul GandhiAhead of the 2026 Tamil Nadu Assembly polls, Congress power-sharing talks within the DMK alliance have triggered fresh seat negotiations. Congress sees 40 seats as ideal, DMK is ready with 32, while Congress has lowered its ask to 38.

SIR notice to Amartya Sen, claims Abhishek Banerjee, slams Election CommissionAlready pointing to SIR notices sent to Indian pacer Mohammed Shami and actor-politician Dev, Abhishek Banerjee alleged that even the Nobel-winning economist has been summoned before the poll body, calling the development "sad."

It is Over: Why a deleted article on Gen Z has taken Pakistan by stormAn op-ed written by a Pakistani PhD student in the US, Zorain Nizamani, the son of an actor couple, on the growing disconnect between Pakistan's ruling elite and Gen Z has grabbed the attention of global media and social platforms. The article was taken down within hours, apparently on the orders of the army, generating a storm in Pakistan.

Why India is tiptoeing around Trump on tariff threat, Venezuela attackHandcrafted ByOur Editors India's response to the capture of Venezuela's Nicholas Maduro, which conspicuously avoided naming the US, Donald Trump, or condemning the military operation, captured the diplomatic spot India finds itself in while dealing with an increasingly erratic US President.

In no hurry to identify cause or solution: Supreme Court raps air quality monitorThe court observed that it was easy to blame buses and trucks for pollution, but questioned how the common man would commute if public transport were halted. The Supreme Court said an expert body should be tasked with identifying pollution sources and providing an estimated assessment of the maximum contributors.

Reliance sees worst session since June 2024. What should investors do now?Reliance Industries shares closed 4.5% lower at Rs 1,507.6, marking their steepest decline since June 4, 2024. During the session, the stock slipped as much as 5.1% to Rs 1,496.30, hitting its lowest level since November 11, as selling pressure intensified.

Rajasthan thief stuck in kitchen exhaust shaft during robbery. Video goes viralPolice said the accused had entered the premises with the intention of committing theft. However, while attempting to squeeze through the exhaust shaft, he got wedged and could not free himself.

CBI summons TVK chief Vijay over Karur stampede deathsThe CBI summoned actor-politician Vijay on January 12 in the Karur stampede case. TVK leaders were previously questioned by the agency. The stampede at a TVK event killed 41 people in September 2025.

Lamp can be lit on hilltop: High Court blasts Stalin govt's 'political agenda'In a setback to the Tamil Nadu government, the Madras High Court upheld an order allowing lighting of Karthigai Deepam at a stone pillar near a dargah atop Thiruparankundram hills, rejecting law-and-order and custom objections.

How old is the oldest serving US judge?An American judge, who is 92, is presiding over the case of deposed Venezuelan president Nicolas Maduro in a Manhattan court. This has fuelled curiosity that if Indian judges retire at a set age of 60 or 62 or 65, why do the ones in the US remain on the bench longer? With the US not having a set year for retirement of judges, who is the oldest serving judge in America?

Deepika Padukone's warm gesture at meet-and-greet leaves fan's mother emotionalDeepika Padukone's warm gesture of holding the fan's mother's hand and inviting her to sit deeply moved the woman, who was left "almost in tears" after meeting the actor. The fan's mother presented a handmade Puran Poli, creating an unforgettable moment for both.

Tata Steel, JSW Steel and SAIL found in breach of antitrust laws: ReportThe Competition Commission of India has also held 56 top executives liable for price collusion over different periods between 2015 and 2023.

Frozen out of Trump's Venezeula plans, Machado wants to give him her Peace PrizeVenezuela opposition leader Maria Corina Machado has offered to dedicate and share her Nobel Peace Prize with Donald Trump after public remarks from the US President signalled Washington's plans for the country would not include her.

Ex-roommate, not ex-boyfriend: Father of Hyderabad woman killed in USThe father of Nikitha Godishala, found dead in the US earlier this month, has clarified that the accused is her former roommate and not her ex-boyfriend. He also urged the government to expedite bringing her body back home.

Bengaluru woman's boss throws surprise party after she gets 2k Instagram followersAiswarya, whose Instagram bio describes her as "a dentist exploring the corporate world," posted the video showing her walking into a boardroom where a whiteboard message read, "Happy 2K followers. Congratulations Aishu."

Pune man stuck in balcony calls Blinkit delivery man for 3am rescueTwo friends in Pune got locked out on their balcony late at night and called a Blinkit delivery agent for help, and a video of the moment went viral.

Paragraph or pointers? What CBSE examiners really want to see in 2026 boardsTo score well in CBSE board exams, students are increasingly planning their answers carefully, deciding how many points to write and which keywords to highlight, turning answer writing into a skill as important as studying.

Schools in Delhi, UP, Punjab and other states to remain shut amid severe cold waveA severe cold wave across India has led to temporary school closures and revised class timings in states such as UP, Bihar, Delhi, Assam, Jharkhand, and Jammu and Kashmir. Check the state-wise list of affected schools.

Men are preparing for pregnancy too, and that's good newsMore men are beginning to acknowledge the odds of infertility among themselves and are rising to the occasion. By doing what women have long done to prepare for healthy pregnancies.

11 Hindus killed in 35 days. Tracking the deadly chronology in BangladeshFrom lynchings and mob attacks to alleged targeted shootings, the killings of Hindus in Bangladesh have unfolded at an alarming rate over the past few weeks. India Today Digital chronologically documents 11 killings of Bangladeshi Hindus in the span of the last 35 days.

Why the world's tallest waterfall never reaches the groundHidden deep within Canaima National Park, the world's tallest uninterrupted waterfall plunges nearly a kilometre from the sheer cliffs of Auyán-tepui. Its waters dissolve into mist above the rainforest canopy, creating a dramatic natural spectacle that defines Venezuela's untouched wilderness and adventure appeal.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 11 | Tolkappiyar: The Creator of the Akam–Puram ArchitectureThe author of Tolkappiyam, Tolkappiyar, may be regarded as one of the earliest anthropologists of the ancient world.

sports.headline: Once hailed as swift as MS Dhoni, England great joins Gujarat Giants as fielding coach England legend Sarah Taylor joins Gujarat Giants as fielding coach for the Women's Premier League 2026, bringing world-class experience to strengthen the team's fielding and overall performance.

Chelsea appoint Liam Rosenior as new head coach, given lengthy contract Chelsea have confirmed the appointment of Liam Rosenior as their new head coach, replacing Enzo Maresca. Rosenior impressed everyone with his work with RC Strasbourg in France and joins the Blues on a lengthy contract.

Shubman Gill trolled after Vijay Hazare Trophy failure vs Goa: Flat track bully India ODI captain Shubman Gill was mercilessly trolled after failing on his return to domestic cricket. Playing against Goa, Gill was dismissed for only 11 runs by Vasuki Koushik.

Indian women would be hard to beat in future: Ashleigh Gardner reveals scary prospect Australia all-rounder Ashleigh Gardner revealed that the Indian women's team would be hard to beat in the near future as their meteoric rise continued with the Women's World Cup win at home last year.

Tactician Meg Lanning runs into uncharted territory to change UP Warriorz fate Former Australian captain Meg Lanning has a huge task in hand as UP Warriorz look to recover and make an impact in the Women's Premier League (WPL) after finishing at the bottom of the table last time around.

Malaysia Open: 20-year-old Ayush Shetty knocks out home favourite in 1st Round Malaysia Open 2026: 20-year-old Ayush Shetty defeated local favourite Lee Zii Jia 21-12, 21-17 in the first round of men's singles at the Super 1000 event in Kuala Lumpur. He joined Lakshya Sen in the second round of the season-opening event.

Virat Kohli walked away from Tests, didn't try to fix his issues: Manjrekar Sanjay Manjrekar has expressed sadness over Virat Kohli's decision to retire from Test cricket early. He believes Kohli could have fought harder to regain form as his contemporaries continue to score heavily in the longest format.

Joe Root debate: Is England star the greatest Test cricketer of the current era? Ashes, AUS vs ENG: Joe Root's composed century in the fifth Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground, backed by unmatched consistency and conversions, cements him as the standout Test batter of the current era.

How Kapil Dev changed Indian cricket even before the 1983 World Cup Long before the 1983 World Cup triumph, Kapil Dev had already emerged as one of India's most entertaining cricketers, redefining fast bowling, all-round excellence and fearless leadership across formats.

Bangladesh Pacer Mustafizur Denied Rs 9.2 Crore Compensation After KKR Release In this special report, India Today's Nitin Srivastava details the controversy surrounding Bangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman's release by Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). The BCCI directed KKR to release Mustafizur, who was bought for ₹9.2 crore, citing 'developments all around' amid diplomatic tensions. Srivastava explains that the pacer is unlikely to receive any financial compensation as he did not attend the training camp or play any matches. The segment also touches on the criticism faced by KKR owner Shah Rukh Khan and the reaction from Bangladesh.

Liam Rosenior confirms he will be Chelsea's new manager: I have agreed verbally Racing Strasbourg head coach Liam Rosenior has confirmed that he is set to become the new manager of Chelsea, revealing that a verbal agreement has been reached following talks with the Premier League club.

Deepti Sharma dethroned as Annabel Sutherland becomes new No. 1 T20 bowlerAustralia all-rounder Annabel Sutherland has replaced Indian spinner Deepti Sharma at the top of the ICC Women's T20I Bowling Rankings in the latest update released on Tuesday.

Vijay Hazare Trophy: Iyer slams 82 on return to pitch after spleen injuryShreyas Iyer returned to competitive cricket with a brilliant 82-run innings in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Iyer has been selected in the India squad for the New Zealand ODI series, where his participation is subject to him regaining full match fitness.

Aashayein khile dil ki: Jemimah stuns fans with rocking performance at Reliance eventJemimah Rodrigues charmed fans with a soulful 'Aashayein' performance at a Reliance Foundation event before turning focus to her new role as Delhi Capitals skipper in Women's Premier League 2026.

Who is Aman Rao? USA-born Hyderabad cricketer smashes Vijay Hazare 200 with sixHyderabad opener Aman Rao, who was born in the USA, smashed a commanding double hundred in a Vijay Hazare Trophy match against Bengal at the Niranjan Shah Stadium in Rajkot on Tuesday.

Ashes: Steve Smith, Travis Head's centuries put Australia in command on Day 3Travis Head and Steve Smith starred as Australia took control on Day 3 of the final Test in Ashes 2025-26 at SCG. Their centuries and England's fielding errors have tilted the contest firmly in Australia's favour.

Sabalenka opens 2026 with a dominant win as Nick Kyrgios exits early in BrisbaneWorld No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka made a blistering start to her 2026 season at the Brisbane International, racing past Cristina Bucsa to reach the third round in just 47 minutes. In contrast, Nick Kyrgios endured a disappointing return to singles action.

Lakshya Sen stretched in first round, Malavika Bansod exits earlyMalaysia Open Super 1000: Lakshya Sen progressed to the second round with a hard-fought win over lower-ranked Jason Teh. In the women's singles field, India's Malavika Bansod lost in straight games to Ratchanok Intanon on Tuesday.

Devdutt Padikkal scripts history with yet another 600 plus Vijay Hazare Trophy seasonDevdutt Padikkal made Vijay Hazare Trophy history against Rajasthan by becoming the first batter to score 600-plus runs in three different seasons, reaffirming his consistency and class in domestic one-day cricket.

Stop experiments and get a manager who fits Manchester United DNA: NevilleGary Neville has urged Manchester United to stop experimenting with managerial appointments and instead appoint a coach who fits the club's DNA following the sacking of Ruben Amorim on Monday.

Vijay Hazare Trophy: Why Gill is playing under Prabhsimran Singh's captaincyShubman Gill returned to play in the Vijay Hazare Trophy after recovering from food poisoning but did not captain Punjab. The team management preferred continuity under Prabhsimran Singh as Gill prepares for the upcoming ODI series against New Zealand.

Mustafizur set to miss Rs 9.2 crore IPL salary as compensation unlikely: ReportIPL 2026: KKR are not legally required to pay Mustafizur Rahman any compensation, as the termination falls under BCCI directive. Existing IPL contract clauses do not mandate salary protection in such cases.

Steve Smith strengthens Ashes legacy, only behind Don Bradman with 37th Test centuryAshes, AUS vs ENG: Steve Smith moved to second in the list of most centuries in the rivalry, going past Jack Hobbs and is only behind the legendary Don Bradman, who has 19 hundreds.

13 years after suspension, cricketer Kranti Gaud's father reinstated in police serviceWomen's World Cup-winning fast bowler Kranti Gaud's father has been reinstated into the Madhya Pradesh Police. He was suspended in 2012 over alleged negligence during election duty.

What led to Stokes and Labuschagne's heated altercation? Stuart Broad revealsFormer England fast bowler Stuart Broad revealed what led to the heated conversation between Marnus Labuschagne and Ben Stokes during Day 2 of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

Too bright to bat: Steve Smith asks Brydon Carse to adjust sunglasses mid-play at SCGAshes, AUS vs ENG: Steve Smith briefly halted play on Day 3 of the SCG Test to ask Brydon Carse to adjust his sunglasses after sun glare disrupted his batting, sparking a light-hearted moment at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

Dense fog delays Shubman Gill, Shreyas Iyer's Vijay Hazare Trophy return in JaipurVijay Hazare Trophy 2025-26: Dense fog and poor visibility delayed the start of as many as four matches in Jaipur on Tuesday. Shubman Gill's Punjab was set to take on Goa while Shreyas Iyer-led Mumbai were up against Himachal Pradesh in their league games in the city.

Ugly way to go: Usman Khawaja out to a full toss in first innings of final TestAshes, 5th Test: Veteran Australia batter Usman Khawaja got out to a full toss in the first innings of his final Test match. He got a standing ovation from the crowd at Sydney Cricket Ground on Tuesday, January 6.

Jemimah Rodrigues will lead Delhi Capitals to maiden WPL triumph: Shree CharaniIndia left-arm spinner Shree Charani is confident that her team, Delhi Capitals, will finally end the title drought in the upcoming season of the Women's Premier League 2026 (WPL 2026). In a conversation with India Today, she revealed how Jemimah Rodrigues' captaincy will usher in a new era for Delhi and lead them to maiden title triumph.

Only had 3-6 months to live: Yuvraj recalls beating death during cancer treatmentYuvraj Singh opened up about his life-threatening cancer diagnosis soon after India's 2011 World Cup win. His successful chemotherapy and strong will led to an inspiring return to international cricket in 2012.

Head enters record books, hits joint-most 100s by an opener in an Ashes seriesTravis Head scored a commanding 163 runs on Day 3 of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney. His innings equalled the record for most centuries by an opener in a single Ashes series, joining an elite list of 11 other players.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
